turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Shall I alert Dr. McCoy?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes. He has a long journey ahead.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Unit two, this is One. The Kobayashi Maru has set sail for the promised land. Acknowledge.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Message acknowledged. All units will be informed.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Calm yourself, Bones.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Sir. Commander, Starfleet on emergency channel. He orders you to surrender this vessel.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No reply, Chekov... Continue on course...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Excelsior closing to 4,000 meters, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, we need everything you've got now.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You did great, Bones... Just great.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Sir, Starfleet calling Grissom again. A warning about us.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Response?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Nothing. As before.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What's Grissom up to?... Will they join us, or fire on us...?  Chekov, break radio  silence. Send my compliments to Captain Esteban.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Admiral, there is no response from the Grissom on any channel.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Keep trying, Chekov. At regular intervals.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Still no response, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bones... Can you give me a quadrant bi-scan?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I'd swear something was there sir, but I might have imagined it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What did you see, Chekov?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: For an instant... A scout class vessel.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Could be Grissom.  Patch in the hailing frequency.  U.S.S. Grissom, this is Enterprise calling. Come in, please.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Nothing on my scanner, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Short range scan, Mr. Chekov... On screen, Mr. Sulu.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Sir, the shields... Non- responsive.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scotty...?

turns.speaker: COMM OFFICER
turns.text: Aye sir, coding now.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Dr. Marcus, it's your planet.

turns.speaker: COMM OFFICER
turns.text: Do you wish to advise Starfleet, sir?

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Wait a minute...! We don't know what we're talking about here...

turns.speaker: COMM OFFICER
turns.text: Sir... Something's jamming our transmission. An energy surge.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Locate.

turns.speaker: COMM OFFICER
turns.text: Surge from astern, sir. Aft quarter!

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: On screen.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Could it be Spock's?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It has to be. Gravitational fields were in flux... It must have soft landed...!

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: In code to STARFLEET... Captain's Spock's tube located intact on Genesis surface. Will relay more data on subsequent orbits.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't believe it...

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why don't we beam it up?

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Oh no you don't! Regulations specifically state: "nothing shall be beamed aboard until danger of contamination has been eliminated." Can you guarantee that?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Not from here, no.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: All right -- get your gear. I'll put you down next time around.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Thank you... <u>Sir</u>!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hello, sir. It's David.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: David... Sorry I'm late.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's okay -- I should have known you'd come... Saavik's right: this planet is unstable. It's going to destroy itself in a matter of hours.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: David!... What went wrong?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I went wrong.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: David, I don't understand...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir. Just don't surrender. Genesis doesn't work! I can't believe they'll kill us for it --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: This is where the fun begins, Saavik!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Like your father... so human.  All units functional, recorders are on... Scanning sector one. Foliage in fully developed state of growth. Temperature, twenty- two point two Celsius.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sector two... Indicating desert terrain. Minimal vegetation, temperature thirty-nine point four.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Sector three... Sub-tropical vegetation... Temperature --  Temperature decreasing rapidly --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's snow. Snow in the same sector. Fantastic!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: ... Fascinating.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: All the varieties of land and weather known to Earth within a few hours walk!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: You must be very proud of what you and your mother have created.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's a little early to celebrate.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Same sector. Metallic mass.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Underground deposit?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Negative, on surface... A manufactured object.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: There's only one thing it could be... Short range scan.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Approximately two meters long... Cylindrical in form...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: A photon tube...!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: New orbit commencing... Coming up on sector three...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Short range scan.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: As before... Metallic mass... Verifying triminium photon tube... No new data.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Check for trace radiation. Infrared enhancement.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: ... Radiation residual... Level is minimal...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: There <u>shouldn't</u> be any. Only plant forms were built into the Genesis matrix.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Cross referenced and verified. An unidentifiable life form reading.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Captain, please -- we'll take the risk. We've <u>got</u> to find out what it is...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: ... Or <u>who</u>.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Saavik to Grissom. Request computer study of soil samples for geological aging.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'll handle that later.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: My readings indicate great instability.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We're not here to investigate geological aging, we're here to find life forms!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: .          .. Spock's tube...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: David --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well. There's your life form reading. These were microbes on the tube's surface. We shot them here from Enterprise.  They were fruitful, and multiplied.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: But... How could they have evolved so quickly...?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Spock's burial robe.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Later. Let's go...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Grissom, your message acknowledged. Will advise... Out.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Saavik... My god, what happened to them?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: It would seem that Grissom was destroyed by an enemy attack.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You mean, we're stranded down here?!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Logic indicates that is the case.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: How can you be logical at a time like this?! We have to get thee hell off this planet!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: That may be difficult...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why don't you just call for <u>help</u>!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I have already made one transmission too many...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: It's time for total truth between us.  This planet is not what you intended, or hoped for, is it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Not exactly.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I used protomatter in the Genesis matrix.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Protomatter. An unstable substance which every ethical scientist in the galaxy has denounced as dangerously unpredictable.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It was the only way to solve certain problems --

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Did your collaborator know?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: My mother knew nothing about it. That's why I asked her to leave Genesis in my hands.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: So, like your father, you changed the rules...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: If I hadn't, it might have been years -- or never!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: And how many have paid the price for your impatience? How many have died? How much damage have you done... And what is yet to come?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: This planet is aging in surges.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: And Spock with it. They are joined together.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: The Genesis wave started a life clock ticking for him and the planet. But at the rate things are going now...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: ... How long?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Days... Maybe hours... Protomatter has made the situation unpredictable.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: It will be hardest on Spock. Soon he will feel the burning of his Vulcan blood.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Pon Farr. Vulcan males must endure it every seventh year of their adult life.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I still don't...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Whoever they are, they're getting closer.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I'll go...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No!... I'll do it.  Give me your phaser.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: If equipment is functioning properly, indications are -- an animal life form.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: You said there wouldn't be any.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Captain... the logical alternative is obvious... beaming down to the surface is permitted...

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: "... If the Captain decides that the mission is vital and reasonably free of danger." I know the book, Saavik.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Grissom to landing party. We have you approaching radioactive indications. Do you concur?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Affirmative, Captain. Our readings are well below danger level.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Very well. Exercise caution, Lieutenant. This landing is Captain's discretion and I'm the one who's out on a limb.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I'll try to remember that, Captain.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Captain, this is Saavik. We have strong life sign readings bearing zero-one-five relative, and we are proceeding to investigate.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: We concur, Saavik. And Saavik... be advised we are reading a severe and unnatural age curve on the planet. I'm getting nervous...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Do you have an explanation?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Captain, this is Saavik. Come in, please...

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Yes, Saavik, go ahead...

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Ah, Saavik, that's, ah, extroadinary. What would you, ah, like to do next?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Request permission to beam aboard immediately.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Saavik... Does Dr. Marcus think there could be -- any chance of -- ah -- radioactive contamination?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: None that I can detect, sir.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: Well, all the same, I'm going to advise Starfleet and get instructions.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I'm sure Starfleet would approve, sir.

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: I know, but -- let's do it by the book. Stand by on this channel.  Go.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Captain, what's happening?!

turns.speaker: ESTEBAN
turns.text: We are under attack! Stand by for evasive -- stand by for --

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I'm almost done, sir. You'll be fully automated by the time we dock.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Your timing is excellent, Mr. Scott. You've fixed the barn door after the horse has come home. How much refit time till we can take her out again?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Eight weeks, sir.  But you don't have eight weeks so I'll do it for ya in two.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott. Have you always multiplied your repair estimates by a factor of four?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Certainly, sir. How else can I keep my reputation as a miracle worker?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Your reputation is secure, Scotty.  Mr. Sulu, take the con. I'll be in my quarters.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott...

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir, but as far as I'm concerned, there's nothin' needed for space travel that this old girl doesn't already have.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Come, come, Scotty. Young minds. Fresh ideas.  Be tolerant.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: As promised, she's all yours, sir. All systems automated and ready. A chimpanzee and two trainees could run her.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thank you, Mr. Scott. I'll try not to take that personally.  My friends... I can't ask you to go any further. Dr. McCoy and I have to do this. The rest of you do not.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I'd be grateful, Admiral, if you'd give the word.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Gentlemen... may the wind be at our backs. Stations please!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Steady... Steady... All right, Mr. Scott.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Sir...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The <u>doors</u>, Mr. Scott!

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Aye, sir, she's got her second wind now.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scan for vessels in pursuit!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, all power to the weapons systems --

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Aye, sir!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott: two photon torpedoes at the ready. Sight on the center of the mass.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Aye, sir!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Good shooting, Scotty.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Aye, those two hits should stop a horse, let alone a bird.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Precautionary, Mr. Chekov. Shields up...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm all right -- stand by to return fire! Mr. Scott, transfer power to the phaser banks --

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Oh, God, sir, I dinna think so...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: They've knocked out the damn automation center.  I've got no control over anything!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How many more?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Just him, sir!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bones, help Spock! Everyone else, find a station!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Admiral, this is Lieutenant Saavik.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Saavik... Is... David with you?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Yes, he is. And someone else. Vulcan scientist of your acquaintance.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: This Vulcan -- is he alive?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: He is not himself -- but he lives. He is subject to rapid aging -- like this unstable planet.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What happened...?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: He gave his life to save us. That is all I know.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Is there <U>anything</U> we can do?!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Only one thing, Sir... Get him off this planet... His aging is part of what's going on around us...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: The Genesis planet is gone.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Goodbye, David.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Yes, Admiral. But that may not be possible.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What? What are you saying?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: The Katra ritual is meant to deposit Spock's consciousness in the Hall of Ancient Thought - not in his body.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But we have Spock alive! That's more than we bargained for!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Or less. What you describe is called Fal Tor Pan - the refusion. It is very dangerous. The elders may not choose to attempt it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And if they don't.? What will Happen to Spock?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: . He will remain always as he is.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: My God...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Much is at stake...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I know you... Do I not?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes. And I know you.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: My father says you have been my friend... You came back for me.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You would have done the same for me.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Why would you do this...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Because... the needs of the one outweighed the needs of the many.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes, yes, Spock...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The ship... Out of danger...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You saved the ship, Spock. You saved us all. Don't you remember?!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: On course, Admiral. Estimating Spacedock in two point one hours.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Very well.  Mr. Chekov, I need pre-approach scan... Take the science station, please.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: ... Admiral, what's going to happen to Enterprise?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: She's to be decommissioned.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: The word, sir?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The word is no.  I am therefore going anyway.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Count on our help, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'll need it, Sulu.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: ... We have cleared Spacedoors.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: FULL IMPULSE POWER!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Warp Speed, Mr. Sulu...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Aye, sir, Warp Speed...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Excelsior, the great experiment, is adrift in space.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott: as good as your word.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Estimating Genesis 2.9 hours, present speed.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Can we hold speed, Mr. Scott?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: We are secured from Warp Speed... Now entering Genesis Sector of Mutara Quadrant.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What about Grissom, Mr. Chekov?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: See! That shimmering area.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Yes, sir. It's getting larger as we close in.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That distortion is closing rapidly... Opinion, Sulu?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: I think it's an energy form, sir...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes. Enough energy to hide a ship, wouldn't you say?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: ... A cloaking device?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Red alert, Mr. Scott.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Klingon Bird of Prey, sir! She's arming torpedoes...!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Fire, Mr. Scott!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu, what is the crew complement of a Bird of Prey?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: About a dozen officers and men.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: With some on the planet...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Sir, planet core readings unstable... Changing rapidly...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What about surface life signs...?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Close... There --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: If I read this right, sir, we have full power.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Go, Sulu!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: We are clear and free to navigate.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Best speed to Vulcan. Mr. Chekov, take the prisoners below.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: The planet Vulcan. In hailing distance, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Saavik. Send to Ambassador Sarek. Tell him we're coming in.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu, you're on manual.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: It's been a while, sir. Here we go... Retrothrusters!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura, any response from Starfleet on our Project Genesis inquiries?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: No, sir, no response.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hmm.. Very odd.  Scotty. Progress report?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Standby automatic approach system ... Advise approach control.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Approach control... this is Enterprise. Ready for docking maneuver.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Would you look at that?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: My friends, the great experiment: Excelsior, ready for trial runs...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: How is Doctor McCoy, sir?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That's the good news. He's home in bed, full of tranquilizers, and he promised me he'd <U>stay</U> there... They say it's exhaustion...  We'll see.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Gentlemen. Good evening.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Good evening, Commander. Everything ready?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Yes, Admiral. Step into my parlor.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Will you be able to handle that...?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Oh, I'll have "Mr. Adventure" eating out of my hand. And I'll see you at the rendezvous.  All my hopes.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Welcome aboard, Admiral.

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Welcome home, Jim.

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Where's Doctor McCoy?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Indisposed, sir.

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Ah, too bad... Well... You have all done remarkable service under the most -- difficult of conditions. You'll be receiving Starfleet's highest commendations, and more importantly, extended shore leaves.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Admiral, I don't understand. The Enterprise --

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Jim, the Enterprise is twenty years old. We think her day is over...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But, we had requested -- we were hoping to take her back to Genesis...

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Genesis?! Whatever for?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why -- a natural desire to help finish the work we began!

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: That's out of the question. No one is going to Genesis!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: May I ask why...?

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Jim, in your absence, Genesis has become a galactic controversy... Until the Federation Council makes policy, you are all under orders not to discuss with anyone your knowledge of Genesis... Consider it a quarantined planet. And a forbidden subject.

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Jim... You are my best officer and if I had a best friend, you'd be that too. But I am Commander, Starfleet, so I don't break rules!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Don't quote rules, Harry! We're talking about loyalty. And sacrifice. One man who died for us, another who has deep emotional damage --

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Now wait a minute! This business about Spock  and McCoy... Honestly, I have never understood Vulcan mysticism -- I'm sorry! But part of me doesn't want you to make a fool of yourself... Understand?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Harry, you don't have to believe! I'm not even sure I believe. But if there's even a chance that Spock has an eternal soul -- then that is my responsibility.

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Yours...?!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: As surely as if it were my own!  Harry, give me back the Enterprise! With Scotty's help...

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: No, Jim! Enterprise would never stand the pounding.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then I'll find a ship -- I'll hire a ship.

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Out of the question! The Council has ordered that no one but the science team goes to Genesis!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then let me speak to the Council! Harry, <U>please</U>! I can <U>make</U> them understand!!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes... I hear you.  I just had to try.

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Of course... Now take my suggestion, enjoy your leave -- and let all this tension blow away.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You're right.  Thanks for the drink.

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Any time.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I say again: Grissom, this is Enterprise. Admiral Kirk calling Captain Esteban or Lieutenant Saavik. Come in!

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Report status!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Torpedoes coming in -- !

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Do not lecture me about treaty violations. The Federation, in creating an ultimate weapon, has become a gang of Intergalactic criminals. It is not I who will surrender, it is you.  On the planet below, I have three prisoners from the team who developed your doomsday weapon. If you do not surrender immediately, I will execute them, one at a time, as enemies of galactic peace.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Who is this?! How dare you --

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Who I am is not important. That I have them is.  I will let you speak to them.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: David?... David!

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Admiral, your young friend is mistaken. I meant what I said. And now, to show my intentions are sincere... I am going to kill one of the prisoners.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Wait! Give me a chance --

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: There are two more prisoners, Admiral. Do you want them killed too?  Surrender your vessel!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: All right, damn you! All right!  Give me a minute to inform my crew.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Commander, Klingon vessel. Stand by to board this ship on my next signal.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: No tricks, Kirk. You have one minute.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No tricks. I'm looking forward to meeting you. Kirk out.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Maltz. Prisoners are at beam coordinates. Standby...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You should take the Vulcan, too.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But, why?

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Because you wish it.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Genesis, I want it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Beam the Vulcan up -- And we talk.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Give me what I want -- and I'll consider it...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You fool -- look around you! This planet is destroying itself!

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Yes. Exhilarating, isn't it!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: If we don't help each other, we'll all die here!

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Perfect! That's the way it shall be!... <U>Give me Genesis</U>!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Give me your hand and we both live.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Don't be a fool -- give me your hand!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Ambassador, I -- I had no idea you were here...  I think you know my crew...

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: I will speak with you alone, Kirk.
